image.altText: A women with short dark hair and glasses looks seriously at the camera.

props.synopsis: IUDs can be inserted by GPs, gynaecologists and family planning doctors, but in Alice Springs there aren't enough local professionals trained to do so.

title.children: Women waiting months, considering interstate travel for birth control

image.altText: Darwin Harbour InpexLNGLiquified Natural Gas

props.synopsis: The NT government has opened an investigation into oil and gas giant Inpex after the company admitted it has been under-reporting potentially toxic emissions from its flagship Ichthys LNG plant on Darwin Harbour.

title.children: Gas giant Inpex under investigation after admitting to pollution error

image.altText: A woman in a red dress walking to court as cameramen take photos of her.

props.synopsis: On day two of the defamation trial of senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price, a witness tells the court the chief executive of one of the NT's largest land councils took a "sustained hit" to his reputation when news broke about an alleged no-confidence motion last year.

title.children: Senator Nampijinpa Price civil trial hears CEO's reputation 'hit' after media coverage

image.altText: A man in a checked shirt holding a new born baby

props.synopsis: Timothy Hunt is sentenced to life in prison for the murder of missing Darwin man Tony Rowe, in what Justice Sonia Brownhill described as a "bizarre, brutal and cowardly attack".

title.children: Timothy Hunt sentenced to life in prison for missing Darwin man's murder

image.altText: Four men stand in front of outback pub

props.synopsis: Northern Territory government backbenchers charge taxpayers thousands of dollars in travel as "assistant ministers", a role not officially recognised by the parliament.

title.children: 'Gammon' assistant minister roles rack up travel costs on public purse

image.altText: A young man skates at a skate park.

props.synopsis: Outdated and forgotten skate parks in the NT forced skaters to build their own underground spot. After years of neglect, experts ask why a region struggling with youth crime can't maintain one of the simplest crime prevention tools there is.

title.children: Skate parks are low-cost, high-value — but Darwin's are virtually unusable

image.altText: A checkout stacked with groceries including tomato sauce and shampoo

props.synopsis: Independent wholesale distributors are calling on the federal government to reconsider the $50 million food subsidy scheme for remote stores that rolled out on July 1 of this year.

title.children: Remote food subsidy scheme accused of creating a monopoly

image.altText: A sign for the Alice Springs Hospital, out the front of the healthcare facility

props.synopsis: NT Coroner Elisabeth Armitage is investigating the death of a 33-year-old Alice Springs mother of three who was unable to be revived after repeated medical sedations in 2023.

title.children: Coroner probes death of psychiatric patient who was repeatedly sedated

image.altText: An apprentice electrician working with a wire.

props.synopsis: One in eight electrical apprentices are being exposed to potentially deadly shocks at work, as the industry struggles with worker shortages, inadequate support and delays in training.

title.children: Electrical apprentice told being shocked at work 'is part of the job'

image.altText: Talia Scriven sits amongst brown reeds wearing large rattan earrings and a beige jacket. She has brown hair.

props.synopsis: A first-of-its-kind South Australian study finds access to compensation after a road accident is not good enough for First Nations people.

title.children: Road accident compensation not culturally safe, study says

image.altText: Man in blue jumper and black bucket had smiles to the camera.

props.synopsis: Some Australians would rather stay home and talk to an AI bot than go out with friends, according to a YouGov survey.

title.children: ‘A great friend’: Young Australians on their relationships with AI chatbots

image.altText: An aerial photo of a new housing estate with empty blocks and several new houses being built.

props.synopsis: Industry experts warn – despite improvements – Australia will fail to meet its housing targets if skills shortages and regulatory barriers are not addressed.

title.children: Building a house in Australia is slower than it was a decade ago

image.altText: A person filling a glass with water from a tap

props.synopsis: Many people would say the benefits of fluoride in water are clear but in this state it's often not there and there will be lasting health impacts.

title.children: 'The Queensland smile' to live on as fluoride is removed from water

image.altText: A dark-haired, bearded man in a dark suit stands in front of some microphones.

props.synopsis: The vice-president urged Israel to have "a little bit of patience" with Hamas as the militant group tries to find the remains of deceased hostages.

title.children: Gaza ceasefire going 'better than expected', JD Vance says

image.altText: A woman with short hair and blue blazer claps while on stage behind a lecturn holding a microphone.

props.synopsis: An MP says new donation caps on political groups such as Climate 200 mean the days of independents spending up to $2 million on election campaigns are "gone".

title.children: Unsuccessful independent's $2m campaign spend the highest in Australia

image.altText: Photos of the underside of a Baby Maugean skates in a tank

props.synopsis: From a specimen unexpectedly launching itself out of a tank, to another dying from a gastrointestinal blockage, and bite marks made during mating rituals, the ABC can reveal the challenges scientist face keeping the endangered Maugean skate species alive.

title.children: There are now 124 Maugean skates in captivity — but can they ever be bred and released?

image.altText: A wooden table and bench in front of an outback pub.

props.synopsis: Locals flock to waterholes and outback pubs to escape the heat, as temperatures soar to the mid-40s.

title.children: Record-breaking heatwave to consume larger parts of Queensland for days

image.altText: Brittany Higgins walking into the ACT court with her head down.

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins abandons her appeal of a WA Supreme Court finding that she defamed her ex-boss and former Liberal Senator Linda Reynolds in a series of social media posts.

title.children: Brittany Higgins abandons appeal over Linda Reynolds's defamation win

image.altText: Mark Nawaqanitawase  looks to his right during a Roosters' NRL match.

props.synopsis: Ex-Wallabies winger Mark Nawaqanitawase and Reece Walsh are among four players named to make their debuts for Australia in the opening Ashes rugby league Test against England.

title.children: Nawaqanitawase becomes dual international as Kangaroos name Test squad

image.altText: CCTV footage of a man wearing a gas mask using a sledgehammer to break through glass

props.synopsis: The theft of several royal treasures at the Louvre on Monday was not the first museum jewellery heist this century to resemble a Hollywood movie. Here's a look back at two infamous capers to steal near-priceless jewels.

title.children: Before the Louvre, these were the biggest heists of the 21st century

image.altText: A composite image of two men, both wearing black sunglasses, walking outdoors looking serious.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for a Canberra man charged with raping a teenager in 2022 have told a jury there is a real chance if found guilty he would be taking the fall for someone else.

title.children: Canberra man on trial for raping teenage girl calls co-accused a 'liar'

image.altText: A composite image of Donald Trump and Kevin Rudd.

props.synopsis: Former prime minister Malcoim Turnbull says any talk of removing Kevin Rudd as ambassador to the United States should be ignored.

title.children: Turnbull gives Albanese a 10, backs Rudd to stay in US

image.altText: The outside of an aircraft printed with the letters REX in blue and orange

props.synopsis: Regional Express Airlines has found a buyer after the company went into voluntary administration last July.

title.children: Rex Airlines finds US buyer after voluntary administration

image.altText: A sign that says Amazon.com

props.synopsis: Millions of apps, websites and services rely on AWS, one of the world's largest cloud computing platforms. Here's what we know about the outage.

title.children: What we know about Amazon's AWS outage and why it was such a big deal

image.altText: Logan Hospital entrance and signage, south of Brisbane.

props.synopsis: A public health probe has so far failed to identify the source of the poisonings, which authorities say aren't being treated as suspicious.

title.children: Police working with health authorities after five people ingest rat poison

image.altText: Australian cricket captain Alyssa Healy speaks to players before a game, with the shot taken from outside the huddle.

props.synopsis: Alyssa Healy suffers another injury at the pointy end of a World Cup, ruled out of Australia's clash against England with the finals on the horizon.

title.children: Skipper Healy out of Australia's blockbuster World Cup clash with injury

image.altText: Man wearing a red shirt serving a customer at the cash register of a music shop with walls filled with shelves of records.

props.synopsis: Tucked away at the end of an old arcade strip, a local record store has survived three decades of change, from new technology to the construction of Sydney's second CBD.

title.children: How an independent record store survived the waves of MP3 and streaming

image.altText: Nicolas Sarkozy waves to the crowd, walking next to wife Carla Bruni.

props.synopsis: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy is due to start serving a five-year sentence in prison, after being convicted of criminal conspiracy over a plan for late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi to fund his electoral campaign.

title.children: Fall from grace as Sarkozy trades the Élysée Palace for a prison cell

image.altText: A photo of a man with red hair in a blue t-shirt looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: A magistrate rejects an application by an accused rapist to prevent media from reporting on his alleged links with accused paedophile childcare worker Joshua Dale Brown.

title.children: Accused sex offender Michael Wilson fails in media suppression bid

image.altText: a man touching green weeds

props.synopsis: A Lockyer Valley man has accidentally found a toxic weed not seen in the region for more than half a century.

title.children: One of Australia's worst weeds unearthed in Australia's 'salad bowl'

image.altText: A man plays in a sandpit with his four children.

props.synopsis: Homeschooling rates are rising rapidly, with families claiming schools aren't coping with bullying or neurodiversity.

title.children: 'Accidental' homeschooling grows, as families blame struggling schools

image.altText: Josh Giddey chats with Dyson Daniels wearing a towel

props.synopsis: Two young Aussies have gotten paid, teams continue to plot to take down the Thunder and LeBron's future continues to be a talking point. Here are five things to keep an eye on as the NBA season gets underway.

title.children: Boomers duo, a dynasty bid and retirement tour — things to watch as NBA returns

image.altText: Alessia McCaig sprints

props.synopsis: As the UCI Track Cycling World Championships get underway at the Velódromo de Peñalolén in Santiago this week, the Australian team aims to overcome its geographical limitations and lack of racing to claim gold.

title.children: Despite lacking race practice, Aussie track riders look for gold in Chile

image.altText: A map of Australia with markers and a search field with the words 'your place' inside it.

props.synopsis: Ancient First Nations stories are all around us — if you know where to look.

title.children: Ancient Australia mapped: What Deep Time stories are near you?
